conclusion: To determine the time during which there is an induced current in the square conductor frame, we need to analyze the motion of the frame as it moves through the magnetic field.
The square conductor frame has a side length of l.
The magnetic field has a width d.
The frame moves with a constant speed v.
We are given that l < d.
An induced current is generated in the frame when there is a change in magnetic flux through the frame.
This occurs when any part of the frame is within the magnetic field region.
The frame starts moving from outside the magnetic field.
The front edge of the frame enters the magnetic field first.

premise: The frame will be completely inside the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance l into the field.
conclusion: The frame will start exiting the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d.

premise: The frame will start exiting the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d.
conclusion: The frame will be completely outside the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d + l.

premise: The frame will be completely inside the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance l into the field.
conclusion: Entry Time: The time taken for the front edge of the frame to move from the start of the magnetic field to being completely inside is l/v.

premise: The frame will start exiting the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d.
conclusion: Full Inside Time: The time during which the frame is completely inside the magnetic field is from when the front edge is at l to when it is at d, which is (d - l)/v.

premise: The frame will be completely outside the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d + l.
conclusion: Exit Time: The time taken for the frame to move from being completely inside to completely outside is again l/v.

premise: Entry Time: l/v, Full Inside Time: (d - l)/v, Exit Time: l/v
conclusion: The total time during which there is an induced current is the sum of the entry time, full inside time, and exit time.

premise: The total time during which there is an induced current is the sum of the entry time, full inside time, and exit time.
conclusion: Therefore, the total time is: (l + (d - l) + l)/v = (d + l)/v
